channel.title: good dlc`s
channel.description:
dlc`s are widely regarded as a cheap way to squeeze more money out of a franchise,but i`d like to hear in this thread some opinion on good dlc`s,there`s gotta be some good ones in this world of 15$ map packs :fffuuu:
i`d say all oblivion dlc`s were kinda neat and added to the overall experience,except for the utterly useless,shadowmere glitching,horse armor
[img]https://www.beefjack.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/04/horse-armor.jpg[/img]
"here now pay us 2 dollars"
also,all future black mesa dlc will be orgasmic

item.title: good dlc`s
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
I know if I got my hands on that monster truck I would accidentally blow myself up at least once.

Read full topic

item.title: good dlc`s
item.dc:creator: Apollomasque
item.description:
A grenade launching monster truck
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dxz4zAsj1AA
Just Cause 2 is pretty sweet.

Saint’s Row 2 DLC is worth your time solely because it let’s you give your character bitching sideburns

item.title: good dlc`s
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
I didn’t like most of the Fallout 3 Dlc because they didn’t capture the feel of Fallout 3. They felt like linear combat centered mods.

Read full topic

item.title: good dlc`s
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
Point Lookout for Fallout 3 is quite good, if a bit short.
So is Operation: Anchorage, if only for the Dragoon Stealth Armour.
Actually, Broken Steel is good too.

Read full topic

item.title: good dlc`s
item.dc:creator: taxi_evil
item.description:
The Ballad of Gay Tony for GTA IV. The Lost and the Damned was awesome, I really enjoyed the story, but then they released TBoGT and took it to another level

Full length campaigns and side missions in each, now both on disc for around £15. Awesome

Possibly someone here might know if the Mass Effect/Mass Effect 2 DLC is worth it? I’m undecided, I bought preowned so I don’t even have the firewalker pack yet

Read full topic

item.title: good dlc`s
item.dc:creator: mrfohlin
item.description:
In my opinion The Battle of Forli and Bonfire of the Vanities for Assassin’s Creed II was pretty good. Added 2 chapters which I really enjoyed. Huge plus! :3

Read full topic

item.title: good dlc`s
item.dc:creator: Dust
item.description:
SURPLUS_NiNjA:

Or Broken Steel.

It was my favourite DLC, closely followed by Point Lookout. I completed Broken Steel with no slowdown or game breaking glitches.

item.title: good dlc`s
item.dc:creator: Omega_Absolute
item.description:
Gears 2 has all 19 Multiplayer maps + the addon campaign mission for 800 MS points. Beats the hell out of CoD’s 3 maps for $15.

item.title: good dlc`s

item.description:

item.title: good dlc`s
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
Dust:

You clearly haven’t played Mothership Zeta. It was boring, and was actually broken. I could not complete it without using console commands, and even then I had a hard time. The Pitt is pretty bad as well though, it had some really poorly optimized areas.

Or Broken Steel.

Read full topic

item.title: good dlc`s
item.dc:creator: Dust
item.description:
Stuntz:

All the Fallout 3 DLCs… well except The Pitt… that was probally the most bugged DLC they had, plus it wasn’t THAT great…

You clearly haven’t played Mothership Zeta. It was boring, and was actually broken. I could not complete it without using console commands, and even then I had a hard time. The Pitt is pretty bad as well though, it had some really poorly optimized areas.
